markdownRemark.html:
A quick fix!

If you are doing Server Side Rendering (SSR), static page generation and the like, these are process that can’t use the window object! Since the window object is only in a browser! When you run your packager, let’s say for now Webpack since thats probably the overwhelming winner of the you’re gonna get the dreaded:

WebpackError: ReferenceError: window is not defined

The Root Issue

If you’re reading this in 2018, 2019, and 2020, the statement shown next to that error is likely an npm module that hasn’t yet been built for SSR or static page generation (think GatsbyJS). For example:

const somePackageThatUsesTheWindowObject = require('some-package-that-uses-the-window-object');

or

import somePackageThatUsesTheWindowObject from 'some-package-that-uses-the-window-object';

or heck, maybe you’re even directly referencing the window object:

let iInnerHeight = window.innerHeight;

if you’re using react, you’ll notice this error won’t be thrown, if you’re access the window object in

The Solution
